title: List of major-party United States presidential candidates who lost their home state
added: * In [[1844 United States presidential election|1844]], [[Henry Clay]] lost [[New York (state)|New York]], the home state of his running mate [[Theodore Frelinghuysen]].
* In [[1848 United States presidential election|1848]], [[Lewis Cass]] lost [[Kentucky]], the home state of his running mate [[William Orlando Butler]].
* In [[1852 United States presidential election|1852]], [[Winfield Scott]] lost [[North Carolina]], the home state of his running mate [[William Alexander Graham]].

* In [[1856 United States presidential election|1856]], [[John C. Fr√©mont]] lost [[New Jersey]], the home state of his running mate [[William L. Dayton]]. [[Millard Fillmore]] lost [[Tennessee]], the home state of his running mate [[Andrew Jackson Donelson]].

* In [[1860 United States presidential election|1860]], [[Stephen A. Douglas]] lost [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], the home state of his running mate [[Herschel Vespasian Johnson]]. [[John C. Breckinridge]] lost [[Oregon]], the home state of his running mate [[Joseph Lane]]. [[John Bell (Tennessee politician)|John Bell]] lost [[Massachusetts]], the home state of his running mate [[Edward Everett]].
